PetPolicySummary: Brussels Airlines accepts only cats and small dogs. In-cabin: maximum 8 kg (18 lb) including a soft-sided, fully closable, leak/smell‑proof carrier that fits under the seat (within 55 x 40 x 23 cm, or total 118 cm/45 in). Pet must remain fully inside the carrier for the entire flight. One pet bag per passenger; up to 2 adult pets may share one bag if comfortable, or 2 littermates (≤6 months) from the same litter, total still ≤8 kg. Age: pet must be ≥15 weeks; for travel to the USA, only dogs ≥6 months are accepted per CDC rules. Booking is required in advance and subject to availability (maximum 4 pet containers per aircraft); bring two signed copies of the “Form for carrying an animal in the passenger cabin” to check-in. Seating: window seat; not allowed in first/bulkhead or exit rows; not seated near other pets. Fees apply and vary by route. Hold (checked as baggage): cats and dogs accepted in an IATA-compliant, hard-sided crate (no wheels), ventilated on all 4 sides, with water and food dishes attached and accessible from outside; pet must be able to stand, turn, and lie comfortably; maximum crate size as baggage is 125 x 75 x 85 cm. Check in early; fees vary by route and crate size band. Snub-nosed (brachycephalic) breeds are not accepted in the hold; cabin may be possible if all PETC rules are met. Pets are not accepted on Brussels Airlines flights to/from the United Kingdom (only cargo options). Travelers are responsible for all entry/transit documents and vaccinations; dogs to the USA must meet CDC requirements (including designated arrival airports and Dog Import Form).
ImprovedPetPolicySummary:
Brussels Airlines Pet Policy

Allowed animals

  • Cats and small dogs only.

In the cabin (PETC)

  • Weight/size: up to 8 kg (18 lb) including carrier; soft-sided, leak/smell‑proof, fully closable, without a rigid frame; must fit under the seat within 55 x 40 x 23 cm (or total 118 cm / 45 in).
  • Behavior/condition: clean, healthy, calm/well‑behaved; not pregnant; must remain fully inside the carrier (including head and tail) for the entire flight.
  • Age: 15+ weeks. For travel to the USA, only dogs 6+ months are accepted (CDC rule).
  • How many: 1 pet bag per passenger. Two adult pets may share one bag if comfortable, or two littermates (≤6 months) from the same litter may share—total still ≤8 kg including the bag.
  • Seating: window seat required; not allowed in first/bulkhead or exit rows; not seated near other pets.
  • Booking: request in advance (via My booking or the Service Centre); limited availability—maximum 4 pet containers per aircraft.
  • Documents: bring two signed copies of the “Form for carrying an animal in the passenger cabin” to check‑in.
  • Fees: charged per one‑way and vary by route; see airline for current amounts.

In the hold (AVIH – checked as baggage)

  • Accepted animals: cats and dogs.
  • Crate: IATA‑compliant hard‑sided crate with solid top; clean, lockable, leak‑ and escape‑proof; no wheels; floor lined with absorbent material; ventilated on all 4 sides (vent openings placed over the upper two‑thirds). One water and one food dish attached and reachable from outside (left empty at drop‑off; feeding/watering instructions affixed).
  • Size: pet must be able to stand, turn and lie comfortably; maximum accepted crate size as baggage: 125 x 75 x 85 cm (larger must be shipped as cargo).
  • Check‑in: arrive early (at least 2 hours before latest check‑in time).
  • Age: generally 15+ weeks; for the USA, only dogs 6+ months per CDC.
  • Fees: charged per one‑way and depend on route and crate size band.

Breed and route restrictions

  • Snub‑nosed (brachycephalic) breeds are not accepted in the hold; cabin carriage may be possible if all PETC rules are met and documents are presented.
  • United Kingdom: pets are not accepted on Brussels Airlines flights to/from the UK (only cargo transport possible).

Documentation and responsibilities

  • Passengers are responsible for complying with all import/transit/export rules and carrying all required documents (permits, health/vaccination certificates, pet passport/ID).
  • Dogs to the USA: must comply with current CDC dog‑entry rules (including CDC Dog Import Form and designated arrival airports).
inCompartmentDetails: Cats and small dogs may travel in the cabin if the total weight (pet + soft-sided carrier) is ≤8 kg/18 lb. The carrier must be leak- and smell-proof, fully closable, without a rigid frame, and stow completely under the seat in front within 55 x 40 x 23 cm or total 118 cm/45 in. The pet must be clean, healthy, calm/well-behaved, not pregnant, and remain fully inside the carrier (including head and tail) for the entire flight. Age: ≥15 weeks; for travel to the USA, only dogs ≥6 months are accepted (CDC). One pet bag per passenger. Two adult pets may share one bag if they are comfortable together, or two small pets (≤6 months) from the same litter may share, total still ≤8 kg including the bag. Seating rules: window seat required; not permitted in first/bulkhead or exit rows; not seated near other pets. Booking must be requested in advance and is subject to availability (maximum 4 pet containers per aircraft). Bring two signed copies of the Form for carrying an animal in the passenger cabin to check-in. Fees apply and vary by route.
inCargoDetails: Cats and dogs may be carried in the aircraft hold as checked baggage (AVIH). Pet must be clean, healthy, not pregnant, and kept in a suitable IATA-compliant hard-sided transport crate with a solid top, secure door fastenings, no wheels, leak- and escape-proof construction, and a floor lined with absorbent material. The crate must be large enough for the animal to stand upright, turn around, and lie down comfortably. Ventilation is required on all 4 sides with openings placed over the upper two-thirds. One water and one feed dish must be attached to the door or accessible from outside (left empty at handover); feeding/watering instructions must be affixed. Maximum crate size accepted as baggage: 125 x 75 x 85 cm; larger must be shipped as cargo. Check in with your pet at least two hours before the latest check-in time. Age: generally ≥15 weeks; for travel to the USA, only dogs ≥6 months are accepted per CDC rules. Fees are charged per one-way and vary by route and crate size band. Snub-nosed (brachycephalic) breeds are not accepted in the hold.
carrierCompartmentDetails: Soft-sided carrier only; fully closable; leak/smell-proof; no rigid frame; must fit under seat within 55 x 40 x 23 cm (or total 118 cm/45 in). One carrier per passenger. Window seat required; not allowed in first/bulkhead or exit rows; not seated near other pets. Bring two signed copies of the cabin pet form.
carrierCargoDetails: Hard-sided, IATA-compliant crate with solid top; clean, lockable, leak- and escape-proof; no wheels; securely fastened; floor lined with absorbent material; ventilated on all four sides with vent openings placed over the upper two-thirds. Attach empty water and food dishes accessible from outside; affix feeding/watering instructions. Max crate size as baggage: 125 x 75 x 85 cm; larger must ship as cargo.

serviceAnimalDetails:
Service Animals (In-Cabin & Support)

Service animals (SVAN), such as seeing-eye dogs, hearing dogs, diabetes alert dogs, mobility or seizure alert dogs, can travel free of charge with Brussels Airlines.

  • Must be fully trained to obey your commands and behave appropriately throughout the itinerary.
  • Must not bark, growl, or jump on people or other animals to ensure safe and undisturbed flight operation.

On board:

  • The dog must fit in the foot space in front of your seat and is not allowed on passenger seats.
  • The dog must remain in the same spot for the entire flight duration.
  • The dog must be secured by a leash to the seat, and you must be able to do this yourself.
  • Securing the dog with a harness is recommended over a collar.
  • Brussels Airlines strongly requests bringing a muzzle as an added precaution and consideration for other passengers.
